benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts - Retrieve an account by external key

covered: Valid Request: Success cases verified with default behavior and all optional query params (balance, CBA, audit), returning 200 and application/json.
Empty Response: 404 covered for nonexistent externalKey and empty database.
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid/invalid combinations, missing required param, unknown param ignored, boolean/audit validation, boundary lengths, and security (SQLi/XSS).
Authorization: 401 covered for missing and invalid tokens.
Audit Levels: FULL and MINIMAL explicitly tested; default NONE inferred from absence of audit info in default case.
Resilience: Dependency failure (503), bad gateway/inconsistent data (502), and timeout (504) covered.
Performance: Response time under normal and concurrent loads covered.
Pagination: Not applicable for single-resource retrieval by externalKey (omission acceptable).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No scenarios verifying throttling/429 or Retry-After under burst traffic.
Caching Behavior: No validation of ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, Cache-Control, or 304 Not Modified.
Authorization (Forbidden): No 403 scenario for authenticated but unauthorized access (if applicable).
Audit=NONE explicitly: Not tested as an explicit value (only inferred via default).
Parameter precedence: No test defining behavior when accountWithBalance and accountWithBalanceAndCBA are supplied with conflicting values.
Content negotiation: No Accept header variations or 406 Not Acceptable handling.
Internationalization: No test for Unicode/UTF-8 externalKey values.
Schema validation: No end-to-end validation against the Account schema (only spot-checking fields).
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests with burst traffic; verify expected outcome (200 within limits, 429 with Retry-After when throttled).
Add caching tests: assert ETag/Cache-Control in 200 responses; send If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to validate 304.
Include a 403 Forbidden test for authenticated-but-unauthorized users if the API enforces role/tenant authorization.
Add an explicit audit=NONE scenario and optionally validate case sensitivity (e.g., audit=full should be rejected or normalized).
Define and test precedence when both accountWithBalance and accountWithBalanceAndCBA are present with conflicting values; document expected behavior.
Introduce JSON schema validation of the Account response (fields, types, required properties) to align with #/definitions/Account.
Add Unicode externalKey tests (e.g., percent-encoded non-ASCII) to validate internationalization support.
Add Accept header negotiation tests (e.g., Accept: application/json vs text/plain) and verify 406 behavior if unsupported.
